transcript.text: he's coming out yesterday apparently
president Trump's pick for CIA director
Mike Pompeo has met with Kim jong-un did
it over Easter what do you think about
that you know I think it's actually
shouldn't be much of a surprise to us
frankly you know Mike Pompeo is
extraordinarily well trusted in this
administration he's been the president's
consul yeri on intelligence matters he's
absolutely the right guy to do this he
applies a lot of continuity to the
mission he's been reading intelligence
on North Korea during his entire tenure
as director of CIA if anyone was
wondering whether Mike Pompeo is worthy
of being Secretary of State this is a
diplomatic initiative and he's taking
the lead with significant expertise so
you get it should President Trump get
credit for this well I think it's an
it's an excellent decision on his part
you know this is pre summit planning and
I think there was a lot of concern when
the decision for a summit was originally
announced that there would not be the
sort of planning that needs to take
place in order for this thing to go off
without a hitch we've even heard
discussions about where the summit will
take place reportedly five different
locations are being considered then
you've got all of the issues that need
to be discussed Mike Pompeo carries a
lot of weight in this administration but
equally is important with our allies in
the region with South Korea in
particular and with Japan he's a very
he's a known entity he's trusted among
our foreign allies and he's a I think a
very strong leader from our
administration to take to take hold of
this this discussion before the summit
truly a remarkable time in history for
sure thank you so much for joining us
Daniel we appreciate it my pleasure have
a good morning you too
